subject: How to get output of test runs?
msgSnippet: Hey all, I have built my own test harness, mostly for running UI Automation tests with Swing apps. I have tests extend TestCase, and I run them inside my own
messageBody:
Hey all,

I have built my own test harness, mostly for running
UI Automation tests with Swing apps. I have tests
extend TestCase, and I run them inside my own
TestRunner. However, I use the TestResult of JUnit and
execute it like so:

Test t = TestSuite.createTest(className, methodName);
if (null != t){
TestResult tr = new TestResult();
t.run(tr);
doSomethingWithResult(tr);
}

So, I am able to get the result, but what I would like
to do is fine a way to mimic the report output that
the <junitreport> tag in Ant does. Is there something
built in to junit that takes a TestResult and spits
out html, xml or something else automatically for me?

Thanks.
